page.title: 01Kelmscott Village & Surround
page.content: The villages of Kelmscott and Grafton are situated in the south-west of Oxfordshire, bordering onto Gloucestershire. The area is farmland both dairy and arable, with the river Thames flowing through the middle. The farming community is a close-nit one and long established. Most of the housing in the area is associated with the farms, although some commuters from Swindon are now joining in village life. Four new houses have recently been built in Kelmscott. William Morris had his summer home at Kelmscott Manor for many years, and this attracts tourists to the village all through the year. The River Thames also carries a large number of holiday boats in the summer and attracts coarse fishermen. The only church is St. George's at Kelmscott, and the only pub is the Plough.
